page.title: 05LINSTOCK CASTLE FARM
page.content: We interviewed Mr and Mrs Wannop who own Linstock Castle Farm and two others in the area.The 'Castle' is a Norman fortified farm ,built to keep out border raiders and original a priory founded by Henry 1 in 1123.It is well preserved and still lived in today.The Wannops have 600 cattle each year 300 calves are born and 200 of these are sold in Carlisle cattle market for meat.500 acres are kept for cereal crops (300 wheat, 200 barley.)The farm complex (3 farms) support 8 families,with 14 employed.About 1000 sheep are bought in and fattened up'during the summer ,when the grass is rich .Mr Wannop has a highly mechanised farm but does not believe in destroying hedgerows or using to much fertiliser or pest spray.Deer are allowed to roam through Mr.Wannop's woodland plantations.
